name: Arm Circles
description: A dynamic shoulder warm-up exercise rotating the arms in circular motions. This fundamental movement increases blood flow to the shoulder joint and prepares the upper body for activity.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, arms extended to sides
Make small circles with arms, gradually increasing size
Perform 10-15 circles forward
Reverse direction for 10-15 circles backward
Keep core engaged and posture upright

name: Leg Swings
description: A dynamic hip mobility exercise swinging the leg forward and backward or side to side. This movement opens the hips and prepares the lower body for running, jumping, or leg exercises.
instructions: Stand next to wall or support for balance
Swing one leg forward and backward in controlled arc
Keep leg relatively straight, allow natural knee bend
Perform 10-15 swings, then switch legs
Option: perform lateral swings across body

name: Walking Lunge with Twist
description: A dynamic stretch combining a forward lunge with a torso rotation toward the front leg. This compound movement opens hips while mobilizing the thoracic spine.
instructions: Step forward into lunge position
Lower until both knees at approximately 90 degrees
Rotate torso toward front leg, arms extended or hands together
Return to center, step forward into next lunge
Alternate legs, rotating toward each front leg

name: Inchworm
description: A dynamic full-body stretch walking hands out to plank position then walking feet to hands. This flowing movement stretches hamstrings and calves while engaging the core and shoulders.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hinge at hips, place hands on floor (bend knees if needed)
Walk hands forward to plank position
Hold briefly, then walk feet toward hands
Stand up and repeat
formCues: Keep legs as straight as possible

name: World's Greatest Stretch
description: A comprehensive dynamic stretch combining a lunge, hip opener, and thoracic rotation. This multi-planar movement addresses hip flexors, hamstrings, thoracic spine, and groin in one flowing sequence.
instructions: Step into deep lunge, back knee can hover or touch ground
Place same-side hand as front leg inside the foot
Drop elbow toward inside of front foot
Rotate and reach opposite arm toward ceiling
Return hand to ground, switch sides

name: Cat-Cow
description: A flowing spinal mobility exercise alternating between arching and rounding the back. This yoga-derived movement gently mobilizes the entire spine while coordinating with breath.
instructions: Start on hands and knees, wrists under shoulders, knees under hips
Inhale: drop belly, lift chest and tailbone (Cow)
Exhale: round spine, tuck chin and tailbone (Cat)
Flow smoothly between positions with breath
Continue for 10-15 cycles

name: Hip Circles
description: A dynamic mobility exercise rotating the hips in circular motions while standing. This movement lubricates the hip joint and prepares the pelvis for lower body activities.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hands on hips
Make large circles with hips, as if hula hooping
Perform 10-15 circles in one direction
Reverse direction for 10-15 circles
Keep upper body relatively stable

name: Torso Twist
description: A dynamic rotational stretch twisting the upper body side to side. This movement warms up the spine and engages the obliques while improving rotational mobility.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Extend arms in front or place hands on shoulders
Rotate torso to the right, then to the left
Allow arms to swing naturally with the rotation
Keep hips facing forward as much as possible

name: High Kicks
description: A dynamic hamstring stretch kicking the leg high while walking forward. This movement actively stretches the hamstrings while warming up the hip flexors.
instructions: Stand tall, arms extended forward at shoulder height
Kick one leg up toward opposite hand
Keep kicking leg straight
Step forward and repeat with opposite leg
Maintain upright posture throughout

name: Dynamic Butt Kicks
description: A dynamic quadriceps stretch jogging while kicking heels toward glutes. This movement stretches the quads while warming up for running activities.
instructions: Stand tall and begin jogging in place or forward
Kick heels back toward glutes with each step
Keep thighs perpendicular to ground
Pump arms naturally as if jogging
Maintain quick, light foot contacts

name: Shoulder Rolls
description: A gentle mobility exercise rolling the shoulders forward and backward in circular motions. This simple movement releases shoulder tension and increases blood flow to the upper body.
instructions: Stand or sit with arms relaxed at sides
Raise shoulders toward ears
Roll shoulders back, squeezing shoulder blades
Lower and roll forward to complete circle
Perform 10-15 rolls, then reverse direction

name: Neck Rolls
description: A gentle neck mobility exercise rotating the head in semi-circular motions. This movement relieves neck tension and increases cervical spine mobility.
instructions: Stand or sit with shoulders relaxed
Drop chin toward chest
Slowly roll head to one side, ear toward shoulder
Continue to other side in semi-circle (avoid full back extension)
Reverse direction after several reps

name: Ankle Circles
description: A mobility exercise rotating the ankle joint in circular motions. This movement prepares the ankles for weight-bearing activities and improves ankle range of motion.
instructions: Stand on one leg or sit with leg extended
Lift foot off ground
Rotate ankle making circles with toes
Perform 10-15 circles in each direction
Switch feet and repeat

name: Walking Knee Hugs
description: A dynamic hip and glute stretch pulling the knee to the chest while walking forward. This movement opens the hips and stretches the glutes with each step.
instructions: Stand tall, take a step forward
Lift opposite knee toward chest
Grasp knee with both hands, pull toward chest
Rise onto toes of standing leg for additional calf stretch
Release and step forward to repeat on other side

name: Toy Soldier
description: A dynamic marching exercise kicking straight legs up toward opposite hands. This movement actively stretches hamstrings while improving coordination and balance.
instructions: Stand tall with arms extended straight forward
Kick right leg up toward left hand, keeping leg straight
Lower leg and step forward
Kick left leg up toward right hand
Continue alternating in marching pattern

name: Hamstring Stretch
description: A fundamental stretch targeting the hamstrings by hinging forward at the hips. Can be performed standing or seated for varied intensity. This essential stretch addresses posterior chain tightness common from sitting.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Hinge forward at hips, keeping back flat
Reach toward toes or shins
Hold stretch, breathing deeply
Option: Perform seated with legs extended for deeper stretch

name: Standing Quad Stretch
description: A classic standing stretch pulling the heel toward the glutes to stretch the quadriceps. This fundamental stretch addresses the front of the thigh and hip flexors.
instructions: Stand on one leg, use wall for balance if needed
Bend other knee, grab ankle behind you
Pull heel toward glutes
Keep knees close together
Hold, then switch legs

name: Kneeling Hip Flexor Stretch
description: A deep stretch for the hip flexors performed in a half-kneeling position. This essential stretch counteracts the effects of prolonged sitting and improves hip extension.
instructions: Kneel on one knee, other foot flat in front
Both knees at approximately 90 degrees
Tuck pelvis under, engaging glutes
Shift weight forward slightly
Hold stretch, then switch sides

name: Pigeon Pose
description: A yoga pose deeply stretching the hip rotators and glutes. This powerful hip opener targets the piriformis and external rotators while stretching the hip flexors of the back leg.
instructions: From all fours, bring right knee toward right wrist
Slide left leg back, straightening it
Right shin angles across the mat (adjust based on flexibility)
Square hips toward front of mat
Fold forward or stay upright, hold and switch sides

name: Figure Four Stretch
description: A supine hip stretch crossing one ankle over the opposite knee. This accessible stretch targets the piriformis and glutes while lying on the back for support.
instructions: Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat
Cross right ankle over left knee
Thread hands behind left thigh or around left shin
Gently pull left leg toward chest
Hold, then switch sides

name: Chest Doorway Stretch
description: A pectoral stretch using a doorway to open the chest and front shoulders. This counteracts rounded posture from desk work and improves shoulder positioning.
instructions: Stand in doorway, forearm on door frame
Elbow at shoulder height, 90-degree bend
Step through with same-side foot
Lean forward until stretch felt in chest
Hold, then switch sides
formCues: Adjust arm height for different fibers

name: Tricep Stretch
description: An overhead stretch for the triceps reaching the hand down the back. This simple stretch addresses the often-neglected back of the upper arm.
instructions: Raise one arm overhead
Bend elbow, reaching hand down toward upper back
Use other hand to gently press on elbow
Hold stretch, feeling it in back of arm
Switch arms

name: Cross-Body Shoulder Stretch
description: A stretch for the posterior deltoid and rotator cuff pulling the arm across the body. This essential stretch improves shoulder mobility and addresses tension in the back of the shoulder.
instructions: Bring one arm across chest at shoulder height
Use other hand to press arm toward body
Keep shoulders level, don't rotate torso
Hold stretch in back of shoulder
Switch arms

name: Standing Lat Stretch
description: A lateral stretch reaching overhead and bending to the side to lengthen the latissimus dorsi. This stretch opens the side body and improves overhead mobility.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart
Raise both arms overhead, clasp hands
Lean to one side, creating a C-curve with body
Feel stretch along side of torso and under arm
Hold, return to center, repeat other side

name: Standing Calf Stretch
description: A wall-assisted stretch for the gastrocnemius and soleus muscles. This essential stretch addresses calf tightness from walking, running, and heel-wearing.
instructions: Face wall, hands on wall at shoulder height
Step one foot back, keeping heel on ground
Bend front knee, keep back leg straight
Press back heel into floor
Hold, then switch legs

name: Child's Pose
description: A restful yoga position stretching the back, hips, and shoulders. This grounding pose promotes relaxation while gently opening the posterior chain.
instructions: Kneel on floor, big toes touching
Sit back on heels, separate knees hip-width or wider
Fold forward, extending arms in front or alongside body
Rest forehead on mat
Breathe deeply, relaxing into position

name: Cobra Stretch
description: A prone backbend opening the chest and stretching the abdominals. This yoga-derived position counteracts forward flexion and improves spinal extension.
instructions: Lie face down, hands under shoulders
Press hands into floor, lifting chest
Keep hips on ground
Elbows can stay bent or straighten based on flexibility
Hold, breathing into chest

name: Butterfly Stretch
description: A seated groin stretch with soles of feet together and knees falling to sides. This classic stretch opens the inner thighs and hip adductors.
instructions: Sit on floor, bring soles of feet together
Hold ankles or feet with hands
Allow knees to fall toward floor
Sit tall and gently press knees down with elbows
Hold, breathing into the stretch

name: Frog Stretch
description: An intense groin and hip opener on hands and knees with knees spread wide. This deep stretch targets the hip adductors and inner thighs.
instructions: Start on all fours
Spread knees as wide as comfortable
Turn feet out, inside edges on floor
Rock hips back toward heels
Hold, adjusting depth as needed

name: Seated Spinal Twist
description: A seated rotational stretch twisting the spine to improve thoracic mobility. This classic stretch addresses spinal rotation and stretches the glutes and outer hip.
instructions: Sit with legs extended
Bend right knee, place foot outside left thigh
Place right hand behind you for support
Twist torso to right, left elbow outside right knee
Hold, breathe deeply, then switch sides

name: 90/90 Hip Switch
description: A seated hip mobility drill transitioning between internal and external rotation positions. This movement improves hip rotation range and control essential for athletic performance.
instructions: Sit with right leg in front, bent 90 degrees (external rotation)
Left leg behind, bent 90 degrees (internal rotation)
Sit tall, knees touching ground if possible
Lift knees and switch leg positions
Alternate sides fluidly

name: Couch Stretch
description: An intense hip flexor and quad stretch performed with the rear foot elevated against a wall or couch. This deep stretch addresses chronic hip flexor tightness from prolonged sitting.
instructions: Place one knee at base of wall, foot pointing up the wall
Other foot flat on ground in lunge position
Squeeze glute of back leg, tuck pelvis
Hold stretch, progressing upright as flexibility allows
Switch sides

name: Thoracic Spine Rotation
description: A targeted mobility drill rotating the thoracic spine while stabilizing the lower back. This exercise improves mid-back rotation essential for golf, throwing, and daily activities.
instructions: Start on all fours or side-lying position
Place one hand behind head
Rotate that elbow toward ceiling, opening chest
Reverse, bringing elbow toward supporting arm
Repeat, then switch sides

name: Wall Ankle Mobility
description: A drill stretching the ankle into dorsiflexion using a wall for resistance. This exercise improves squat depth and reduces risk of ankle-related movement compensations.
instructions: Face wall, place one foot a few inches back
Keep heel down, drive knee toward wall
Knee should pass over toes toward wall
Hold at end range or perform controlled reps
Switch feet

name: Wrist Circles
description: A mobility exercise rotating the wrists in circular motions to improve range of motion. Essential warm-up for any pressing, gripping, or wrist-loading activities.
instructions: Extend arms in front or interlock fingers
Make circles with wrists, moving hands
Perform 10-15 circles in each direction
Vary size of circles
Include flexion, extension, and rotation

name: Shoulder Dislocates
description: A shoulder mobility drill passing a stick or band in an arc from front to back over the head. This exercise improves shoulder flexion and extension range despite its alarming name.
instructions: Hold stick or band with wide grip in front
Keeping arms straight, raise overhead
Continue arc until stick/band is behind you
Reverse the motion to return to start
Narrow grip as flexibility improves

name: Deep Squat Hold
description: A primal resting position holding the bottom of a squat to improve hip, ankle, and thoracic mobility. This fundamental position is natural for humans but lost with modern chair-sitting.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width or wider
Squat down as deep as possible
Keep heels on ground (elevate if needed)
Hold position, working on depth over time
Use support initially if needed

name: Jefferson Curl
description: A controlled spinal flexion exercise rolling down vertebra by vertebra with weight. This advanced mobility drill improves spinal segmentation and hamstring flexibility progressively.
instructions: Stand on elevated surface, light weight in hands
Tuck chin, round upper back first
Continue rolling down one vertebra at a time
Let weight pull you into deep forward fold
Reverse, uncurling from bottom up

name: Prone Scorpion
description: A prone spinal rotation stretch reaching one foot toward the opposite hand behind the body. This dynamic mobility drill opens the hip flexors and rotates the thoracic spine.
instructions: Lie face down, arms extended to sides at shoulder height
Keeping shoulders down, lift right leg
Rotate and reach right foot toward left hand
Feel stretch in hip flexor, chest, and spine
Return and repeat on other side

name: Thread the Needle
description: A quadruped thoracic rotation stretch threading one arm under the body. This gentle mobility drill opens the upper back and shoulder while improving spinal rotation.
instructions: Start on all fours
Reach right arm under body toward left side
Let right shoulder and temple rest on ground
Left arm can stay planted or reach overhead
Hold, then return and switch sides
